content.description: SDS on the right side of the low overhang, to the right of Bloodroot, with hands in the slots, move up using some small slopey crimps to establish yourself on the short face and top out.
content.location: This route is located on the side of the Springtime Boulder, that faces the approach trail, which is the obvious lowball boulder seen to the left as you're hiking in to the East Side Boulders on the recently rerouted approach trail.

content.description: SDS on the downhill side of the boulder, just around the short arete from Bloodroot, and move up past a sidepull/gaston feature to the top lip of the boulder and mantle.
content.location: This route is located on the downhill side of the Springtime Boulder, which is the obvious lowball boulder seen to the left as you're hiking in to the East Side Boulders on the recently rerouted approach trail.

content.description: SDS on the left side of the low overhang with hands in the slots, move up onto the left hand arete and short face and mantle.
content.location: This route is located on the side of the Springtime Boulder, that faces the approach trail, which is the obvious lowball boulder seen to the left as you're hiking in to the East Side Boulders on the recently rerouted approach trail.
